attributes.gcd: Refers to the basis on which interest accrual is calculated. Suggested defaults are 1 for 30/360 for amortizing transactions OR 3 for Act/Act. for nonamort. Currently this attribute is only consumed by ALM application.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.
Refers to the frequency by which interest is compounded. Currently this attribute is only consumed by ALM application.
Refers to compounding frequency, which is used calculate interest income. Compounded interest is calculated only when the compounding frequency is <less than payment frequency.

Refers to the unit of compounding frequency, possible values are D, for days, BD, for business days, W, for Weeks, M, for month, y, for Year. Column is applicable for instruments like Equity convertible bond.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

Refers to the unique identifier of the day count indicator. Expected values are A/360, A/365, A/A, 30/360, 30/360 EUROPEAN, 30/A. Suggested default value are 1=30/360 for amortizing transactions OR 3=Act/Act. for non amortization.

Flag indicates whether the given dimension value record has been disabled or expired. The list of values includes Y- Indicates that the dimension value has been disabled, N- Indicates that the dimension value is not disabled and is still active.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.

Refers to the interest rate code that identifies the index to which adjustable rate accounts are tied. Transfer Pricing references interest rate code when calculating option costs and uses the relevant interest rate from the defined interest rate code, IRC, together with the margin to determine the reprice rate for the instrument. The value populated in this column for each account record must be synchronized with the actual interest rate code values defined in Transfer Pricing.

Refers to the interest rate code that identifies the index to which adjustable rate accounts are tied. Transfer Pricing references interest rate code when calculating option costs and uses the relevant interest rate from the defined interest rate code, IRC, together with the margin to determine the reprice rate for the instrument. The value populated in this column for each account record must be synchronized with the actual interest rate code values defined in Transfer Pricing.
Refers to the interest Rate Code Name.
Refers to the description of interest rate curve.
Refers to the interest rate format code corresponding to what type of Yield is applicable for an instrument. For example, ZCYC for Zero Coupon Yield Curve, YTM for Yield to Maturity etc.
Refers to the equivalent numeric identifier of the Interest Rate Type.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Flag indicates risk free rate. List of values are Y and N.
It Indicates if dimension record is seeded by product or not. The SCD component would not overwrite the record if it is set to 'Y'.
